graph_title: Prévalence de la malnutrition (indice poids/taille supérieur à +2 écarts types ou inférieur à -2 écarts types par rapport à la médiane des normes de croissance de l’enfant définies par l’OMS chez les enfants de moins de 5 ans, par forme (surpoids et émaciation)
indicator_name: Prévalence de la malnutrition (indice poids/taille supérieur à +2 écarts types ou inférieur à -2 écarts types par rapport à la médiane des normes de croissance de l’enfant définies par l’OMS chez les enfants de moins de 5 ans, par forme (surpoids et émaciation)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture
SDG_TARGET: Target 2.2: by 2030 end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under five years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and older persons
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
STAT_CONC_DEF: Prevalence of wasting (weight for height <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age.
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 2.2: by 2030 end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under five years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and older persons
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
un_custodian_agency: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), World Health Organisation (WHO), World Bank (WB)
